name: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
description: Showcasing a comprehensive collection of modern and contemporary art, including painting, sculpture, photography, and design.
metadata: Modern Art, Contemporary Art, Exhibitions, NYC

name: National Air and Space Museum
description: Home to the world's largest collection of historic aircraft and spacecraft, offering insights into aviation and space exploration.
metadata: Aviation, Space, History, Technology, DC

name: The Louvre Museum
description: A world-renowned art museum and historic monument in Paris, famous for housing the Mona Lisa and countless other masterpieces.
metadata: Art, History, European Art, Paris, International

name: British Museum
description: A vast museum dedicated to human history, art, and culture, with a collection of around 8 million works.
location: Great Russell St, Bloomsbury, London WC1B 3DG, UK
metadata: History, Culture, Archaeology, London, World Art

name: Rijksmuseum
description: The national museum of the Netherlands, dedicated to arts and history, featuring masterpieces by Dutch masters like Rembrandt and Vermeer.
metadata: Dutch Masters, Art, History, Amsterdam

name: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
description: A museum of modern and contemporary art designed by Frank Gehry, known for its striking architecture.
metadata: Modern Art, Contemporary Art, Architecture, Spain

name: The Acropolis Museum
description: Focuses on the findings from the archaeological site of the Acropolis of Athens, Greece.
metadata: Ancient Greece, Archaeology, History, Athens

name: Tokyo National Museum
description: The largest museum in Japan, specializing in Japanese and Asian art and archaeological artifacts.
metadata: Japanese Art, Asian Art, Archaeology, Tokyo

name: Australian Museum
description: Australia's first museum, showcasing natural history and anthropology collections.
metadata: Natural History, Indigenous Culture, Australia, Science

name: Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History
description: Dedicated to understanding the natural world and our place in it, with vast collections of specimens and artifacts.
location: 10th St & Constitution Ave NW, Washington, DC 20560
metadata: Natural History, Biology, Geology, Anthropology, DC

name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art (The Met)
description: One of the world's largest and finest art museums, with collections spanning 5,000 years of world culture.
metadata: Art, History, World Culture, NYC, Exhibitions

name: Van Gogh Museum
description: Dedicated to the works of Vincent van Gogh and his contemporaries, featuring the largest collection of his paintings and drawings.
metadata: Art, Post-Impressionism, Van Gogh, Amsterdam

name: The Vatican Museums
description: Museums of the Vatican City, displaying works from the immense collection amassed by popes throughout the centuries.
location: Viale Vaticano, 00165 Città del Vaticano, Vatican City
metadata: Religious Art, History, Vatican, Rome, Renaissance

name: State Hermitage Museum
description: A museum of art and culture in Saint Petersburg, Russia, one of the largest and oldest museums in the world.
metadata: Art, Culture, History, Russia, European Art

name: Pergamon Museum
description: One of Germany's most visited museums, housing original-sized reconstructed monumental buildings.
metadata: Archaeology, Ancient History, Architecture, Berlin

name: Art Institute of Chicago
description: A world-renowned art museum housing a collection of Impressionist, Post-Impressionist, and American art.
metadata: Art, Impressionism, American Art, Chicago

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: Housed in a former railway station, this museum displays French art from 1848 to 1914, including Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces.
location: 1 Rue de la Légion d'Honneur, 75007 Paris, France
metadata: Impressionism, Post-Impressionism, French Art, Paris

name: Natural History Museum (London)
description: A leading centre of scientific research into the natural world, famous for its dinosaur exhibits.
location: Cromwell Rd, South Kensington, London SW7 5BD, UK
metadata: Natural History, Dinosaurs, Science, London

name: Uffizi Gallery
description: A prominent art museum located adjacent to the Piazza della Signoria in the Historic Centre of Florence in Tuscany, Italy.
location: Piazzale degli Uffizi, 6, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy
metadata: Renaissance Art, Italian Art, Florence, History

name: Egyptian Museum
description: Home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities, including the treasures of Tutankhamun.
metadata: Ancient Egypt, Archaeology, History, Cairo
